abstract: Microsoft has so far failed to fire the imagination of the buying public since the Zune digital music player’s release last fall.
snippet: Microsoft has so far failed to fire the imagination of the buying public since the Zune digital music player’s release last fall.
lead_paragraph: Despite the Redmond, Wash., giant’s famously deep pockets and well-documented commitment to the success of its first digital music player, the Zune, Microsoft has so far failed to fire the imagination of the buying public since the player’s release last fall. I overheard a litany of disparaging remarks (“It’s kinda clunky,” for example) from would-be consumers shuffling past a Zune display at the Consumer Electronics Show yesterday.
